Trigger.Name: Prismatic Deception
Trigger.Description:
This trigger calls out Prismatic Deception safe spots when the casts of Blasting Zone start on the enemy list. The calls by default are North, Northeast, East, Southeast, obviously the cardinal/intercardinal direction opposite of what the trigger calls will be safe too. If you prefer, you can change the things the TTS actions call in the Trigger Actions tab of the this trigger.
Version History: v1.4: Public Release v1.5: Rewrote part of this trigger to have fewer moving parts since it wasn't executing consistently v1.6: I swear to god this thing works now

Trigger.Name: # Nael UI Readme
Trigger.Description:
This config set controls the on-screen position following triggers: - Nael Debuffs - Dragon Divebombs - Earthshakers - Grand Octet
The commands must be preceded with the echo (/e or /echo) chat command or it will not take effect.
Commands:
setDefault Resets the entire UI suite in the case of an error where things do not load properly. (Example: /e setDefault)
partyDefault Resets your party tracker that's used for various mechanics across the fight. (Example: /e partyDefault)
=========
naelDebuffX <value> Sets the on-screen X value start point of the UI image. Triggernometry dictates the top-left corner of the image as its start point. (Example: /e naelDebuffX 640)
naelDebuffY <value> Sets the on-screen Y value start point of the UI image. Triggernometry dictates the top-left corner of the image as its start point. (Example: /e naelDebuffX 640)
naelDebuffOpacity <value, 0-100> Sets the opacity of the UI image with 100 being the default (fully visible). Setting the image to 0 will make it fully invisible.
showNaelDebuff Displays the Nael Debuff UI image. For this to work outside of UCoB, please make sure that X, Y and Opacity have values attached to them or the image will not show.
hideNaelDebuff Hides the Nael Debuff UI image. Use this command to hide the UI image if it fails to reset after a wipe or instance change.
=========
naelRPY <value> Sets the on-screen vertical space for displaying Nael RP images. The default is the middle of your screen.
showNaelRP <value, 2-3> Displays a sample image combo with Nael's RP moves. Value dictates if the sample image will show a two or three move combo respectively.
naelRPIcons <value, 0-1> naelRPIcons <command, enable/disable> Sets the option for Triggernometry to enable (1) or disable (0) the showing of Nael RP icons during combat. (Example: /e naelRPIcons 0) (Example: /e naelRPIcons disable)

Trigger.Name: # Reset UCoB
Trigger.RegularExpression: The Unending Coil of Bahamut \(Ultimate\) has ended

Trigger.Name: Heavensfall Trio
Trigger.Description:
This trigger calls out Prismatic Deception safe spots when the casts of Blasting Zone start on the enemy list. The calls by default are North, Northeast, East, Southeast, obviously the cardinal/intercardinal direction opposite of what the trigger calls will be safe too. If you prefer, you can change the things the TTS actions call in the Trigger Actions tab of the this trigger.
Version History: v1.4: Public Release v1.5: Rewrote part of this trigger to have fewer moving parts since it wasn't executing consistently v1.6: I swear to god this thing works now
